item.title: Here We Are, a Comeback Sentence
item.dc:creator: abdillah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: I'm, Yes, I am
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded:
A truly Muslim, competent programmer, skilled martial artist is a goal list of mine. Be that way and proud of that. Not because I have achieve those. But because you love to be those.
I'm a person talk not that much. But I try to write much more. Love a perfect (if possible) article written : whether it's style, content, emphasize, etc. Thus, I like to revise many of them too much.

item.title: Life Explosion Worth to Note
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded: Looking to the past, when floras and faunas are so different. Every of them has their own colour, morphology, and physiology. They're as much varied as here now, a day of August 13th. I mean, it is somewhere 550.000.000 years ago. It is an era of no-human, and no human had ever saw. We, human, just learn and see their trace. The clearest one, fossils, and the gloomy one, imagination and assumption. Of course, people are still in search of the life origin : It is about who created and how they're created. Actually the first quest is omitted by several group of people as they don't believe God−people in-lost. Both question led a lot of research generated. Fortunately, I have belief about the answer of the first, but, the second is really still in question. Once upon a time, I read an article about Cambrian Explosion. It is a kind of article can be found on Wikipedia. It is an event in earth where creatures are, by sudden time, increasing their diversity. A lot of, about sixty, new−biological term−phyla where existed in a sudden (more than a million years, but it is a short time for this right?). This explosion includes simple single-celled to the complex multi-celled organism. People who stick on evolution theory are surprised on this event. Why? It is a short time which is not sufficient to evolve high multi-celled creature even to one or two new different phyla [tooltip tip="Unverified"][c][/tooltip]. It is occurred as that those creatures are created simultaneously, no evolution involved. The end result, as observed nowadays, some phyla existed today have no successor before Cambrian Era. Those phyla's tree of life ended up in that era. This of course, as some people stated, a proof of non-evolving nature of organism. I try to be objective in this one. In conclusion, evolution of creature is a process still in question. It is a doubtfully concept because no strong evidence and there are hesitating proofs.

item.title: Me. Be Useful!
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded: I'm sorry it was abstract. But it doesn't mean, can't be understood. It is a motivational post, to encourage a (small part of) rule of life. It is my nature to give everything, in a good context, a soft touch. Learning much more things is good, well developed attitude. But at widespread topics, within shallow, not-related things should be avoided. As it is just throwing more and more cloudy layer on top of clear glasses, which blocking my view in the leading time. Intent of learning shall be understood as gaining more experience to become creative and innovative person. So, it must be applicable and practical. Learning a hidden, no-one-care protein (e.g. Histon, etc), for example, are not recommended anymore. In exception of time-spare and task-related topic. If it's a thing that is not so practical, it should be at least support analysis of practical cases (or problem in practicing something). A poor (but valid) example is a topic about programming style (e.g. order of writing function args, etc). It is, in my mind, led me to the effective way of programming. Or trying to discover how a disease spread out, or infect someone (a survival topic, huh?). And many others. Another key to hold, I need to define own field of interest as a strong learning boundaries. I ever chatted about "Graphic Processing", "App Dev", "Open Source App Dev", and so on. Which is, fortunately, in a near and related field. And, fortunately, part of it has been known. I should write it HERE later, what is my field of interest. As a closing, I need to describe why initially I build this blog. It's because I need a documentation to wrap my head around about what have I done (e.g. learning, trying, suffering, etc). A small part of my college story, well, it's okay too.

item.title: Recombinant Bacterial
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded:
Back in 1983, the United States government approved the release of the first genetically modified organism. In this case, it was a bacteria that prevents frost on food crops.
— Jeremy Rifkin

item.title: Bluetooth Experience
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded:
I change my perspective about being creative. A software developer, by default, should be creative. I have enough skill now to learn in hurry (e.g. learning by making software itself). I can build a simple milestone (basically one function of main()), expand it, learning some library (as long as there are tutorials and docs, not a mysterious one), implement it, building GUI (using glade), and many more. While skimming through web pages, in my mind passed the word "bluetooth". Well, that's a better in-the-old-time and start to be disposed on daily basis technology. But, it is a key to empower my phone.

Code

Skipping, I will discuss about bluetooth code in the leading text. This code taken from Bluetooth Essentials for Programmer PDF file. 


Heavy commented, as libbluetooth3-dev have no documentation at all. Really annoying.


Compile


Before compiled, install libbluetooth3-dev. Then it can be compiled using,


gcc -o simplescan simplescan.c -lbluetooth


Output

This is taken while the app running and my S5360's bluetooth is on.

$ ./simplescan 
6C:83:36:DF:1C:65 GT-S5360

That's all.

item.title: Strange Memory Allocation from Function Call
item.dc:creator: abdillah

item.title: Heat Holder Water
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday (9 August. 2014), I was only drink two glasses of water (more I think, but still lacked). One in the morning, and the other at noon after lunch. I was in My (Engineering) Faculty from afternoon to dawn, downloading and surfing Internet. Within that time, I was not drinking anything just like fasting, but I didn't as I was lunch before. All faculty's food court still closed due to Syawwal Day Offs. So, no water source (to be drunk) at all.

Implication

After quite sometimes, at dawn, I went home. Quickly, on the way, my body temperature dropped down. My body temperature ended up in lower level. Not so low to make me collapsed (Just felt like a breeze wind passed on—no less no more), but so continuously occurred. This condition proofed something to me.

Theory

Some literature have written that water can hold heat more than most other fluids while its temperature keep unchanged or changed a little. This way, it keeps more heat energy without significant increment on temperature. As reverse, no significant drop of water's temperature while heat energy released.

Analysis

My body which lacked water can't store much heat energy. Thus, the energy on burning metabolism (as a result of my lunch), not stored properly and the majority released throughout the day. In the end, when external temperature drops, no heat energy as a backup and led the body follow the external condition.

item.title: Serial Communication
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded:
Accessing tty* file—a hardware serial interface—have many software options. There are bunch of them which is good, really. But the recommended one is Putty. 
sudo apt-get install putty

item.title: Mono - Open Source C# Framework
item.dc:creator: abdillah
item.content:encoded:
It is almost the time of new semester in my college. One of the subject that I will take is Object-Oriented Programming. It is a usual problem to choose between two programming language : Java and C#. It is actually a common student problem worldwide. At first, I was not fully want to learn C# and choose to learn Java. Stumbled on this site, I flip my choice. [tooltip tip="The Mono site"]It is[/tooltip] a good-looking, convincing site about Mono—an Open Source Microsoft's .NET counterpart. Is it worth learning open source? Right! It is.

Java Experience

Beside, I have a little bitter experience with Java (in desktop mostly). Below is the list.

Over All

  • Easy coding, complete built-in library, Eclipse IDE Wizard and Completion
  • IDE library inclusion is [tooltip tip="I think inclusion using command line is much easier"]complex[/tooltip]

Desktop

  • No Easy Style-able and Customizable GUI : Old AWT, Ugly Swing, nativeness SWT
  • GUI Flaws, cause it is cross platform
  • Troublesome installation of [tooltip tip="Java Runtime Environment"]JRE[/tooltip] (and [tooltip tip="Java Development Environment"]JDK[/tooltip])

Mobile (Android)

  • [tooltip tip="Two years, because it is first time I learn programming"]Easy to learn[/tooltip] as it is provided by Android API
  • Slow, this is due to [tooltip tip="At that time, high performance phone is quite expensive"]my phone[/tooltip]
  • API restricted by rules and semantics (it is a good one, since creates consistency)
  • Hard to [tooltip tip="Buggy GUI builder"]build GUI[/tooltip]

C# Experience

None. Just learn a minute ago, a  hello world program: 
/* Taken from http://www.mono-project.com/docs/getting-started/mono-basics/ */
using System;
using System.Windows.Forms;
 
public class HelloWorld : Form
{
    static public void Main ()
    {
        Application.Run (new HelloWorld ());
    }
 
    public HelloWorld ()
    {
        Text = "Hello Mono World";
    }
}
and how to compiles it 
mcs hello.cs -pkg:dotnet
# then run
mono hello.exe

Conclusion

It's not a kind of conclusive sentence. But, no one care. I will learn C# a little bit more to see if it fits my need.
